New Records: Algeria's 16-game unbeaten streak in AFCON qualifiers - with their last defeat dating back to an away loss to Benin in 2018 and their last home defeat dating back to 2007
Key Match Events: Benrahma (29', 55' pen.), Aouar (68'), Gouiri (86'), El Amine Amoura (90+6') Boudaoui (90+3')
Pre-Game Insights: Algeria's formidable home record in AFCON qualifiers, combined with their current winning streak and defensive solidity, makes them strong favourites to secure a victory
Post-Match Reflections: Togo have struggled defensively, and with their talisman Kodjo Fo-Doh Laba unavailable, they are likely to find it difficult to break down the hosts
Miscellaneous Highlights: Algeria will be without goalkeeper Anthony Mandrea, who has been a regular for the Desert Foxes, due to urgent family matters, while Alexandre Okidja misses out as well due to a reported lack of match fitness
